text: HTd4 <74fly TTHf gifearut Phane 91-11-25074100/25074200 Fax 91-11-25093507/25093514 (4 T37 43r 4Ra37 3< IJTT Taw) Extn 2223/2318/2488/2553 07 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Shipping; Road Transport & Highways) GS & 6, Sector-10_ Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 No, 11041/21/2002-Admn June 3, 2005 POLICY MATTERS: TECHNICAL 53/2005) [Decision teken on CM Division's Note dated 28.05.2005} Sub: Maintenance of entrusted highways during monsoon Regarding: In view of coming monsoon season, all Project Directors are advised to take necessary preventive precautionary measures and be in state of preparedness to meet any eventuality arising out of heavy rains and floods during the Monsoon: Alt the National Highways which have been entrusted to NHAI for widening and strengthening or completed corridors under CM Division should be kept in traffic-worthy condition under all circumstances_ The responsibility for works of maintenance in the sections where widening and strengthening work is in progress is of the civil contractor: The O&M contractors operators are responsible for the sections under CM Division. The following guidelines may be kept in view while formulating and finalizing the action plan on the subject: 1 Sections_under Corridor _Management Qivision: a Ali cross drainage works must be inspected immediately and it may be ensured that   there is no debris dismantled material any other obstruction in the water way: b AII pucca drains, kaccha drains, median   drains , sub-surface   drains, drainage spouts on bridges and drainage pipes in the kerb between the main road and service road etc: are properly cleaned and maintained so that there is no ponding of water on the carriageway or service road  Cont  ..2 M 7 NHAL
